content.description: Sit start with a pair of edges and poor feet. From there, spring up to an edge, then climb through a series of pinches to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but there are rocks around the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the south side of the boulder's east half.

content.description:
Start the same as

Astronomy Dormine

and cruise up until you can go left or right. Head LEFT into the lichen littered part of the wall....  It is not a bad problem - not sure which is harder between the 2 variations.

This is the blue route in the pic.
content.protection: A couple pads and a good spotter.

content.description: Stand start with opposing sidepulls. From there, ascend the slab using edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will do. The landing is okay.
content.location: It climbs the east boulder of the tight corridor between the two.

content.description: Sit start matched on an edge. From there, climb up through the generous features to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will do. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs east half of the boulder at the corridor.

content.description: Start on a flake (that needs to be epoxy'ed) and moves up and left... be careful on this guy - not a lot of traffic has been on this guy, and, typical for Unaweep, certain holds can be fragile.
content.location:
This is around the corner of

Atom Heart Mother

.

content.description: Start on a big sidepull down low right. A big move gains the trending seam underneath the overhung block.

Most of the bad holds have been cleaned and snapped off - the crux is at the top: it is scary without enough pads. This is a small crimp problem all the way through.

It is the red route in the picture.

Start down very low to the right. Make a series of moves on decent-sized crimps to the left.... Start heading up, all the while the crimps get smaller and smaller. You eventually will be able to head left and exit out or continue up and to the right. On Astro-Dor, you head RIGHT. Beware the crux is the move heading right... to some very small, solid, crimps.
content.protection: A couple of pads and a great spot.
